title: B.Stat.-301
text:
Mean vector \(\mu' = (\mu_1 , \mu_2, \dots , \mu_k)'; [k>2]\)
Condition of PDF:

\(\int_x f(x) dx = 1\)
\(f(x) \ge 0\)

Condition of PMF:

\(\sum_x p(x)=1\)
\(0\le p(x) \le 1\)

Example:
\(f(x) = kx^2; [0\le x \le 1]\) is a pdf. Then find k
Answer: Thus f(x) is a pdf, \[\therefore \int_x f(x) dx = 1\] \[\Rightarrow \int_0^1 kx^2 dx = 1\] \[\Rightarrow \frac{k}{3} [x^3]_0^1=1\] \[\Rightarrow \frac{k}{3} \times 1 = 1\] \[\therefore k = 3\] Therfore, the pdf is \(f(x) = 3x^2; [0\le x \le 1]\)

title: B.Stat.-301
text:
Introduction
A vector valued random variable \(X = (x_1, x_2, \dots, x_p)'\) is said to have a multivarite normal distribution with mean vector \(\mu = (\mu_1, \mu_2, \dots , \mu_p)'\) and variance-covariance matrix \(\Sigma = \{\sigma_{ij}\}, i, j = 1, 2, \dots, p\) if its pdf is defined as, \[f(X)=\frac{1}{(2\Pi)^{\frac{p}{2}} |\Sigma |^\frac{1}{2}} exp\Big[ -\frac{1}{2} (X-\mu)'\Sigma^{-1} (X-\mu) \Big] \] or, \[f(X)=(2\Pi)^{-\frac{p}{2}} |\Sigma |^{-\frac{1}{2}} exp\Big[ -\frac{1}{2} (X-\mu)'\Sigma^{-1} (X-\mu) \Big]\] \[-\infty<x_i<\infty, -\infty<\mu_i < \infty \\ \sigma_{ij} > 0; i=1, 2, \dots, p\]

title: B.Stat.-301
text:
Derivation of MND
For univariate, \[f(x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi \sigma^2}} exp\Big[-\frac12 \frac{(x-\mu)^2}{\sigma^2}\Big]\] \[\Rightarrow f(x) = k \times  exp\Big[-\frac12 \frac{(x-\mu)(x-\mu)}{\sigma^2}\Big]\] \[\Rightarrow f(x) = k \times exp\Big[-\frac12 (x-\mu)' (\sigma^2)^{-1}(x-\mu)\Big]\]
